well what a weekend and somewhat of a week it has been for me and my family. So friday I go down to Macon to see Jazmine for the weekend and it was so wonderful to spend time with Jaz and be with friends. So on Saturday Hugh and I were planning on just having a day to our selves, but lo and behold I learn that my grandfather is the hospital. So here I am a hour and half away and I feel so useless.  I have never been away from him when he was in the hospital. So Hugh and I went down to be with my grandparents and I am so glad that Hugh was there b/c with his knowledge he helped my poppa out so much. We stayed with my grandmother Saturday and Sunday we were back in the hospital to be with him b4 we left. On sunday he was so good I mean he was looking better, so I just knew that he would be out sometime this week...it was just his gaulbladder.
Then it came tonight...the news. When they did some test on him they found out that it wasn't his gaulbladder it is a tumor on his stomache. So yeah I freaked out and I am still somewhat upset. They will have to transport him to ATL or Augusta for his surgery and we wont know until Thursday if it is cancer or not...so just the waiting will kill me. I am just worried and upset b/c I am not in the same room as him and I can't do anything about what is going on. This man is more than a granfather to me he is so much to me that I don't know what to do if he were gone.
I am know just sitting here all by myself(Hugh is at work) and I don't know what to do or how to deal with this...I feel so helpless...worthless in this situation and I just want to be closer to him in distance...please everyone keep me and my family in your thoughts and prayers...Love to all...I don't really feel like talking or typing right now...bye

I have had the busiest three or four weeks of my life. Let's see Hugh's dad was in the hospital for two weeks and a few days after he got Hugh's mom went into the hospital so my time has been spent with taking care of them and things like that. And just last week Hugh and I had to take 11 young people to Tennesee for a youth camp, which I have to say was relaxing to an extent. The night before we left I got really sick. But it must have been a 24 hour thing b/c the next day I was weak but ok. 
But anyways where we stayed was so beautiful and quiet. To get to the camp you have to go through Amish country. It was amazing b/c you just can't believe that people can actually live with out electricity and running water. Hugh made the comment that he would like to live like that for thirty days. I don't know if I could do that, I mean I have lived for so long with it. It would be different if I had been raised my whole life like that but I just don't know. But one day Hugh, me and some of our close friends went and visited some of the amish houses. Which I have to say was fun. It was the ride home that was torture. An eight hour trip turned out to be a 12 hour trip and I was not in the best of moods. I gets nerve racking when you are in a van with eleven children and they won't shut up. 
But all in all I have just been real busy. I am trying to get all my ducks in a row,which can be difficult at times...but I have to go

I guess I should expect this though. I mean the person who threw it up in my face didn't have the decency to ask me about it first no they broadcast it over the whole internet that everyone can see and make me look bad like I did something horrible like kill someone. And if you are going to put something about someone so everyone can see it either let the person know and ask them about it first or put what is so appaling to you in your post so people's minds don't wander...I mean and in someone's eyes that looks bad may not be bad at all.  It just IRRITATES me so much.  And people wonder sometimes why I have a hard time trusting people. Last Friday Hugh and I and eight teens from our old church went to Virginia to work at a Junior camp and attend a Senior camp. The junior camp had seventy children from the ages of 5-10. One little boy stole my heart...His name is TJ and he has CP, and he is nine but on the mentality level of a four year old. But none of that stopped him for the four days he was there. He was wonderful at playing sports and loved any kind of ball.  He made all of us laugh and on the last night I sat there and watched him look up at the fireworks and just sit there in amazement.
